definition: to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: Before I could answer, she had turned around and started back out onto the field.
sentences.chinese: 我还未来得及回话，她已经转身向足球场上走去了。

sentences.english: Please take a message to him by way of reply.
Startled at the stillness broken by reply so aptly spoken.
sentences.chinese: 惊异于那死寂漠漠被如此恰当的回话打破。

sentences.english: He didn’t move, as she had expected he would upon hearing this information.
sentences.chinese: 听到回话，他没有动，这出乎她的意料。

sentences.english: Nicolette brought back the reply of M. Jean that he was not ill. He was busy.
sentences.chinese: 妮珂莱特带回让先生的回话，他一点没有病。

sentences.english: In addition, it is often desirable for this state to persist beyond the user's current session.
sentences.chinese: 另外，通常希望状态在当前回话结束后仍然保持。

sentences.english: “But now I can have an immediate answer,” says Mangate.
sentences.chinese: “但现在我可以立即得到回话，”Mangate说。

sentences.english: "They told me they'd call me back in 7-10 business days, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 他说，“他们告诉我，会在7至10个工作日内回话。

sentences.english: Then as he waited for a response, the other three kids turned around too.
sentences.chinese: 趁我准备回话的时间，其他三个孩子也围了过来。

sentences.english: I have become like a man who does not hear, whose mouth can offer no reply.
sentences.chinese: 我如不听见的人，口中没有回话。

sentences.english: How soon could you get back to me?

definition: to utter a word/to make a sound/to cheep/to squeak/also pr. [zi1 sheng1]
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
to interrupt (sb talking)/to butt in/to cut into a conversation
to set off/to take to the road
to question/to ask/to raise a question
to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
to talk/to get into conversation with/to send word
